Blake Weldon }} '''Blake & Brian''' was an American [[country music]] duo composed of singer-songwriters Brian Gowan (born January 7, 1969, in [[Temple, Texas]]) and Blake Weldon (September 13, 1966, in [[Lufkin, Texas]]).{{cite book|last=Whitburn|first=Joel|title=Hot Country Songs 1944 to 2008|publisher=Record Research, Inc|year=2008|page=244|isbn=978-0-89820-177-2}} The two were paired up by record producer Chuck Howard in 1995.{{cite web |url=http://www.countrystandardtime.com/d/cdreview.asp?xid=205 |title=Blake & Brian - ''Blake & Brian'' |accessdate=2008-07-12 |last=Allread |first=Walter |work=[[Country Standard Time]]}} Their self-titled debut album was issued in 1997 on the [[Curb Records]] label. The album's lead-off single, "Another Perfect Day", peaked at No. 45 on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' country charts. ''[[Country Standard Time]]'' gave the album a mixed review, stating that although Gowan and Weldon were "indistinguishable vocally and equally malleable", and although some of the songs were derivative of the [[Eagles (band)|Eagles]], the more up-tempo tracks were "punch[ed] up... with timeless [[Texas]] kick". After releasing this album, they charted two more singles ("The Wish" and "Amnesia"), the latter of which was not included on an album. By 1999, Blake & Brian had parted ways. Gowan released a solo album entitled ''Warm Spanish Wine'' in 2000.{{cite web |url=http://cdbaby.com/cd/gowan2 |title=Warm Spanish Wine |accessdate=2008-07-13 |work=CDBaby.com}} He also co-wrote [[Rodney Atkins]]' 1997 debut single "In a Heartbeat" and three songs on Atkins' 2003 debut album ''[[Honesty (Rodney Atkins album)|Honesty]]''. ==Discography== ===''Blake & Brian'' (1997)=== {{Infobox album | italic_title = no | name = Blake & Brian | type = studio | artist = Blake & Brian | cover = blakebrianalbum.jpg | alt = | released = {{Start date|1997|08|19}} | recorded = | venue = | studio = | genre = Country | length = | label = Curb | producer = Chuck Howard | prev_title = | prev_year = | next_title = | next_year = }} ====Track listing==== #"If Guitars Were Guns" (Brian Gowan, Roger Alan Wade) – 2:21 #"Why, Why, Why" (Mark Selby, Doug Hughes) – 2:33 #"Saving My Love" (Blake Weldon, Tony Stampley) – 3:43 #"The Wish" (Conley White, Sam Hogin, Phil Barnhart) – 3:44 #"There Is No End" (Weldon, [[Bill Rice]], [[Sharon Rice]]) – 3:29 #"Straight to You" (Lee Satterfield, George Teren) – 2:44 #"Another Perfect Day" (White, Barnhart, Brian Tabor) – 3:26 #"Shut Up Heart" (Michael Huffman, Rick Williamson) – 2:27 #"Confederate Rose" ([[Max T.
